item.title: [317] Specific Client Needed to Connect [317]
item.dc:creator: @four_twenty four twenty
item.description:
@four_twenty wrote:

[quote=“four twenty, post:3, topic:318670”][quote author=Ebowne24 link=topic=415131.msg3055474#msg3055474 date=1260419879]
There should be… 2 “Server” server side? One of them should say something like… Clientrequired=1 or something. Put 0.
[/quote][quote author=four twenty link=topic=415131.msg3055410#msg3055410 date=1260413337]

if (client > 0) {
misc.println(“Enforcing Eudora client requirement”);
enforceClient = false;
}
[/quote]

its already 0. i have tried changing it to 1, 2, nothing.

Config.ini

It’s in there.

i don’t think i have a config.ini i have a setconfig.java but nothing in there to do with this.

EDIT: AHHAH!. I have a server.ini and it has this in it.

ClientRequired=0
WorldId=3
ServerPort=43594

so just change that zero to a 1 and it shall work? ill go give it a go.

EDIT: -.- im about to flip lol. that didn’t work it still boots me as soon as i connect.

alright since no one knows, or does know and doesnt want to tell me what i need to do, i will pay someone 5 bucks to do it on teamviewer for me[/quote][quote=“1appie1, post:6, topic:318670”]loook you got to the source fil change it to 0 and then go fuck ur mom[/quote]
Learn to read please. i already did that. and please refrain from cussing and insulting me. i do not appreciate spam like that on my thread. and if you are going to insult someone try to come up with something more creative than that. really.

item.title: [317] Specific Client Needed to Connect [317]
item.dc:creator: @four_twenty four twenty
item.description:
@four_twenty wrote:

The server i am using has a code in it that only allows a specific client to connect to the server. i would like to know how to remove this so i can use a different client.

in server.java there is

public static boolean enforceClient = false;

and

Properties p = new Properties();
p.load(new FileInputStream("./server.ini"));
int client = Integer.parseInt(p.getProperty(“ClientRequired”)
.trim());
world = Integer.parseInt(p.getProperty(“WorldId”));
serverlistenerPort = Integer.parseInt(p.getProperty(“ServerPort”)
.trim());
if (client > 0) {
misc.println(“Enforcing Eudora client requirement”);
enforceClient = false;
}
} catch (Exception e) {
misc.println(“Error loading settings”);
e.printStackTrace();
}

and in client.java there is

if (server.enforceClient && !officialClient) {
println(“Invalid client!”);
returnCode = 12;
disconnected = true;
return;

i need to know what to remove from where. because every time i try, i get errors. thank you for your time.

Read full topic
